text: I thought the place was great. The vegan dishes were delicious. And as far as the place, it had a great vibe to it.

A true gem! The best Vegan spot in Montreal that I need to visit again! The ambiance is wonderful, warm, cool and eclectic. A wonderful mix of old school and new art, colourful and cute. The food is incredible. All meals are home made, recipes are from scratch and the owner Maria is an absolute sweetheart! The coffee, deserts and vegan burgers are incredible! The options are gluten free friendly and you can always ask about the items on the menu. The produce and ingredients are from local farms in Quebec and are all organic. I love this place!

I'm surprised by some of the harsher reviews. The place is small, indeed. The plates, silverware, tables and serving pieces -- eclectic and worn. I'll give you that. I suppose those things don't bother me at all. If you are in search of a polished, fine dining experience, you should probably go elsewhere. However, for the cost, the food is healthy and delicious! I've been twice in the last couple of years and plan to head there again this week.  Had a great experience both times.  Opt for the daily special.  Service can be slow, but that is generally because the server is also the cook who is serving all of the customers.  Plan to spend some time here.  That may be the only reason I knock it down a star, but hardly a reason to pass up the great meal!

A nice, quiet and unassuming vegetarian (with vegan options) cafe. Artsy, eclectic and with a sweet little terrace in the back. Very Mile End. 

Went for brunch. Had the vegan burrito (beans, tomato, avocado, chipotle-- comes with chips and salsa) and shared an almond-milk chai latte and hot apple cider with a friend (both excellent, especially the cider-- both could have been a touch hotter, though). The ingredients were fresh, and the burrito arrived hot and crispy on the outside, warm and wonderful on the inside. The only complaint I had was that it was way under-seasoned (couldn't taste the chipotle and it was woefully under-salted; this coming from a person who is often accused of under-salting when she cooks-- in any case, nothing a little sriraccha couldn't fix). 

Great service and atmosphere; I'd definitely go back.

I love La Lumière du Mile-End! 

Mary, the owner, is lovely and generous. This place is much more than a restaurant; it's a place you meet truly nice people (and enjoy a DELICIOUS vegetarian snack.) ;)

I felt home the second I sat at the "bar" where Mary welcomed me like a friend. 

I had a vegan sandwich loaded with fresh and crispy veggies. Beautiful!!! For me, it was prefect. I usually think that food in restaurant is too heavy, salty and fat. But Mary got it right: the veggie sandwich tastes like VEGGIES! 

Love you Lumière du Mile-End!!! Thanks for sharing you goodness with us! xox

Brilliant!! 
Another one of my favourite spots in MTL
The weekend brunch is always exciting and never falls short of awesome. 
Maria is a true love, she has the biggest heart and you feel it her preparations and restaurant vibe.  
Splendid and uplifting decor.

I went there twice with some friends.
Food is really good (especially the Provençal burger, in my opinion).
The ambience is cool, always playing some good music.
Only problem, it can take a while to be served, both times we were there it took around half-hour to get our orders (only one person to serve 5-6 tables in rushy-lunch hour).
Can't wait to terrace season to try theirs! :)

01.24.13 UPDATE: I've heard that La Lumiere has stepped it up since my August review and a bunch of my friends love this platce. As soon as I go again, I'll update my review, hopefully adding some stars to the walk!

08.30.12 REVIEW: really wanted to love this place. Around the corner, fresh vegan food, grassroots feel, crayons for the kids, courtyard in the back, nice people, etc.

Perhaps four years ago when this place opened it was really nice. But there has been zero attention paid to physical upkeep. Now, what I can imagine was once funky and cute has devolved into dilapidated and careless. Tables were falling apart with nails sticking out of them, courtyard actually backs up to a bunch of garbage bins/dumpster which stinks, etc. 

Food was slow, but decent (probably a three). However, with places like Aux Vivres down the way and Panthere Verte around the corner, well, I think La Lumiere needs to  try harder. A week of scrub-a-dub clean-up and refreshing could have that place back in effect.  

Rating Scale:
1 Star: Avoid the town in which this place is located just to be safe.  
2 Star: Risky at best. 
3 Star: I'll try it again or consume here in a pinch.
4 Star: I eat here regularly if financially and calorically feasible.
5 Star: I'm comfortable taking other chefs here.

Mon expérience à la lumière du mille end était pas aussi agréable que je l'aurais aimé. Je n'ai pas apprécié le fait que ce restaurant/café s'affiche en tant que "vegan/vegetarian" mais les employés sembles ne rien connaître ou comprendre sur le style de vie vegan... J'ai commencé en prenant un Chai Lattée mais j'ai demandé de le faire avec lait d'amandes car je suis lactose intolérante. Ensuite j'ai continué en commandant le burrito à la recommendation de la serveuse car j'étais confuse à ce qui était vegan ou non sur le menu. J'ai par la suite reçu, à ma grande surprise, mon Burrito AVEC fromage après avoir confirmé 2fois avec la serveuse que je voulais mon assiette végétaLienne (vegan). J'étais un peu déçue car je pensait qu'après deux fois, la serveuse aurait compris que je ne PEUX PAS manger de produits laitiers. J'ai reçu mon plats vegan, c'était pas mauvais mais c'était aucunement assaisonné alors j'ai due me débrouiller avec le sel et poivre qui n'étais pas offert sur la table nonplus (le sucre pour le thé étais pas là au début).
Tout ça pour dire que c'était vraiment pas agréable et après avoir finis de manger je me sentais vraiment pas bien ce qui me semblait bizarre parce que je ne pensait pas avoir mangé quoi que ce soit qui m'aurait donné cet effet. En payant j'ai redemandé si le thé (Chai Lattée) avais bien été fait avec du lait d'amandes. La serveuse avait l'air encore plus confuse que quand je lui ai dit que je ne pouvais pas manger de fromage dans mon burrito CAR JE SUIS LACTOSE INTOLÉRANTE!!!

De passage dans Outremont, on en a profité pour venir déjeuner ce dimanche ici, lieu que j'avais mis depuis bien longtemps dans mes signets Yelp! 
Ce café végétarien est très intimiste. Quelques tables, une disposition tout en long, des couleurs chaudes, de la décoration hétéroclite, un peu de musique. 
Il y a plusieurs choix sympa, sandwich chaud ou froid, burger vegan et assiettes déjeunés. 
Nos plats étaient pleins de saveurs et bien garnis! Le service était agréable. 
Le seul bémol est la mauvaise isolation avec quelques courants d'air peu agréable au mois de novembre! À part ça je pourrais y retourner avec plaisir!

Small place, just a few tables, though I heard that in the summer there is a back yard. I came here with my vegetarian friends for dinner, and having read that the portions are not big, in combination with poor planning I had a big chicken sandwich a couple of hours before, so I wasn't very hungry when I arrived. Yet, this turned out to be a good call since some of my friends were late and by the time we ordered it was getting late. The place officially closes at 8 pm, and since we ordered around 7:30 pm we asked to make sure that we wouldn't be rushed out soon, and were subsequently promised it's quite alright to sit there afterwards while they clean up. We had a funny waitress with sass, who gave good recommendations and really sold my friends who wanted the Mexican burger on changing for the burrito because "it's the same just with avocado and easier to eat".  I got the quinoa burger which was ok, and came with some chips. It kinda fell apart while I was eating it, but was tasty enough. The portions are very affordable (all under $10) and while they aren't big, you can add a soup or salad to any sandwich or burger for $4. There's a few drink and dessert options, which I was too full to attempt, but my friends enjoyed some French vanilla lattes, and some baked goods. The one thing that was a little annoying was that while I was not finished with my chips, my plate was pulled from table to be cleared with the rest of the dishes without asking. Luckily, I was full by then, so I just let it go... For a cheap veggie place - it's OK!

Food was delicious and generous. We had quinoa salads, and I had a chai latte. 
Wonderful 1970s veggie hippie ambiance. I felt right at home, as if I travelled back in time. Cozy and small, but not crowded. Comfortable chairs. 
Great music was playing. You could feel the love in the food. Took some dessert home and Mexican bean burgers for tomorrow. 
The banana chocolate chip cookies are so yummy! 
If you like a place where you can feel relaxed and at home, with a rustic feel, this is the place for you. I will definitely be coming back regularly. Very Mile End and trendy. 
Our server, River, was a delight.

Postage-sized old-style hippie joint, complete with emo folkie music playing in the background and a motley assortment of salvaged furniture all cobbled and slapped together.Vegetarian mains,smoothies,tisanes, (they're not much for the real stuff) fair-trade coffee. The proprietor suggested I bring groups here in summer for vegan lunches/dinners, as she has a beautiful backyard.  I saw the "beautiful" backyard, and it looks like a dump site! Afraid to imagine what it looks like in summer! Me thinks not, sorry! I've no idea what the food is like, as I've not tried it, but after seeing the backyard, and overall place, I'm frankly, afraid to.

J'ai essayé une couple de cafés (un chai latte avec lait d'amandes et le latte régulier de l'amie qui m'accompagnait) et le sandwich avocat à la crème. D'après cette amie, un des meilleurs lattes qu'elle a bu parmi tous les cafés qu'on a fait. Pour moi, MEILLEUR SANDWICH parmi tous les dits cafés. 10/10 will go again.

Petit endroit bien sympa dans le mile end ! Des sandwichs végés bien garnis et avec une grosse dose de cheddar et ca j'adore !
Avec les sandwichs on peut prendre des crudités ou des nachos.
Il existe aussi de salades, burgers, plats et un plat du jour.
Tout ce que nous avons gouté était vraiment sympa.
Un bon coin végé dans le mile end que je recommande :)
I go here at least once a week.  It`s always fresh and always amazing and totally affordable.   The staff is friendly and sweet.  I highly recommend it!

Première déception de mon séjour Montréalais et pas des moindres !
Loin d'être lumineux, je n'avais encore jamais été accueillie dans un lieu de la capitale avec aussi peu de professionnalisme et autant de mauvaise volonté...
Après 45 minutes d'attente et de réflexions désobligeantes, entourés de seulement... 2 clients ! Mes amis et moi-même avons décidé de repartir chez le voisin haut en couleurs et jamais décevant : le Dépanneur Café :)
Je ne peux donc pas vous parler de la cuisine, ma patience a décidé de la snober !

La lumière du Mile end, une petite devanture discrète, juste à côté du Dépanneur Café. 
Un nom bien choisi pour ce charmant restaurant - salon de thé- végétarien de la rue Bernard. 

Cet espace est tout plein de gaieté, avec ses murs bariolés, des odeurs fruitées, épicées, caféinées et surtout grâce aux sourires chaleureux de la patronne! 

Le "bijou caché" de ce lieu est sa mini terrasse à l'arrière où quelques tables sont disposées au pied d'un grand arbre, où des petites sirènes se baignent allègrement dans une fontaine.... Allez.. fermez un peu les yeux. 

Je n'ai pas hésité une seule seconde avant d'y emmener mes amies parisiennes venues me rendre visite ! Après une matinée de shopping, le porte-monnaie léger, c'est le spot idéal pour se relaxer et savourer quelques mets sans se ruiner . 

Un menu simple aux saveurs indiennes, Italiennes, provençales, ou encore d'Amérique du sud. Je me souviens des Quésadillas, du Végi-burger indien, du Wrapsody, qui sont excellents. Je vous recommande aussi leurs smoothies au lait d'amande ou soja. Nous les avons presque tous goûté, mon préféré est celui aux bleuets!

Probablement un de mes endroits favoris du Mile-End. On se sent comme chez soi! C'est d'autant plus agréable l'été: il y a une petite terrasse (style jardin) en arrière. La nourriture est excellente, surtout le burger Provençal (quinoa et hummus). En plus, chaque burger est servi sur pain rosette au blé entier: encore mieux pour la santé! Les prix sont très raisonnables et les portions ne sont ni trop petites, ni démesurées. Un incontournable, autant pour la bouffe santé que pour l'ambiance détendue. Plusieurs plats végétaliens également disponibles.

Very cozy and feels like home.
They're weekly special was the pad Thai and was very delicious with peanut homemade peanut sauce.

Daiya cheese available as substitute which we used in the avocado melt sandwich, only thing I can say is they nailed it!
Excellent endroit pour manger un bol vegan ou autre. Endroit simple et mets délicieux!
